problem_text: The width w(G′) of the derived subgroup G′ of a finite non-abelian group G is the smallest positive integer m such that every element of G′ is a product of ⩽ m commutators. Is it true that the maximum value of the ratio w(G′)/|G| is 1/6 (attained at the symmetric group S3)? V. G. Bardakov
answer: Yes, it is (T. Bonner, J. Algebra, 320 (2008), 3165–3171).
